intro: Melampyrum cristatum subsp. ronnigeri, commonly known as the horned smokeplant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, branched inflorescences and small, yellowish-orange flowers. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy coating, aiding in water retention in its often arid environments.
